title: Welcome To My Blog
text:
This is the first post in a Quarto blog. Welcome!

Since this post doesn’t specify an explicit image, the first image in the post will be used in the listing page of posts.

title: About
text: I’m currently getting my master’s degree in mathematics education at the University of Virginia (UVA), and I’d love to teach at a middle school in a diverse community following graduation. I also got my undergraduate degree from UVA in 2020 in Systems Engineering and Statistics, where I also served as drum major of the marching band for two years. In my spare time, I love to play bassoon, read, watch Formula One, and cheer on the Hoos. My resume is linked below:

title: Quadrilaterals Lesson Plan
text: I designed this lesson initially for the course EDIS 5450: Teaching Math in Secondary Schools, to be taught in a seventh grade classroom. Through an inquiry activity and using math manipulatives, students will learn more about how diagonals can be used to classify the different types of quadrilaterals. This lesson represents my teaching approach of developing a deeper mathematical understanding through inquiry based activities, and the use student focused learning.

title: Symmetry and Origami Lesson Plan
text: I designed this lesson during my placement in a high school geometry classroom. During the lesson students complete stations about transformations, including reflections, translations, and identifying symmetry. I specifically designed an activity using nearpod that helps students understand lines of symmetry while folding an origami flower. The origami flower serves as a concrete manipulative to help students learn how shapes “fold” over lines of symmetry. This lesson reflects my teaching approach of developing a deeper mathematical understanding through inquiry based activities, and the use student focused learning.
